The test is passing when run locally using `mvn test -pl examples/java -Dtest=WordCountIT -DskipITs=false -DbeamTestPipelineOptions='["--tempRoot=...", "--project=...", "--runner=org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.testing.TestDataflowRunner"]' -P dataflow-runner` , but fails on jenkins. Most likely issue is that my PR creates a new gcs client for every file which wasn't the case previously. Passing an instance of `GcsUtil` via `GcsCreateOptions` might be a better option instead of passing individual options like `gcsUploadBufferSize` and creating the client in the `GcsFS`
LGTM

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11326056/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11326056)

Coverage remained the same at 70.147% when pulling **98e81aab1aa22535e53d3ba66f52d5475a5a53a2 on reuvenlax:per_table_schemas** into **9f2733ac460ce42d6b3bd49f3db1bacb771ef85c on apache:master**.

This PR does not depend on Jenkins. Perhaps your comment was queued up before the PR was rewritten?  This PR just restores status quo in a totally agnostic way, to unbreak the build.

The feature work you propose sounds perfectly reasonable.

I don't have a strong opinion except that all of those things need to be done portably and documented. You should know, since your comment implies otherwise, that there is no propagation of `tempRoot` to `tempLocation` outside `TestDataflowRunner`. We [explicitly set both `tempRoot` and `tempLocation` for the direct runner](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/examples/java/pom.xml#L195), and just don't run this test on other runners, where it would certainly fail for the current configurations. There is also no documentation on `tempRoot` so I'd say that what you've proposed would give it a defined meaning, which is nice.

thanks @peihe !

Rebased on top of master to pickup build fix.
